Hello everyone,

Well, I got quite a few things to talk about, so I'll get =
right to it:

(1) First of all, a BIG thanks to everyone for their input on=
 my
Honours Project.  It went very well indeed and I've put it online now
s=
o anyone who is interested can check it out at:

http://www.redcrocodile.ne=
t/source/

Any feedback would be greatly appreciated, but don't forget that=
 I'm
still relatively new to the field of NE :)

(2) Right, so after this l=
ast 3 months of work (and ~6 months of
research) I am seriously thinking ab=
out continuing on studying
computational neuroscience and the many topics t=
hat Ken and his
colleagues have been working on: intelligent systems, NE, A=
E, plastic
synapses, and modular NN design along with heterogeneous NN desi=
gns
such as gas nets (which I know very little about at the moment).  The
w=
ork/research that I would do would be applied to autonomous agents
using en=
vironments/scenarios from video games as testbeds.  The entire
field fascin=
ates me and has done so for a significant amount of time.
 The reasons behi=
nd such contemplations are numerous and well thought
out, but I won't dwell=
 on them any further for the moment.

So, now that I have a BSc (Hons) in C=
omputer Games Technology, my
question to the group is where I should go fro=
m here.  If I continue
with education, the goal at the end of the journey w=
ill be a PhD.  No
doubt about it.  I read Julian's post about the Universit=
y of Sussex
and that appears to be a MARVELOUS institute for such studies, =
but I
am curious to know if anyone else has any recommendations.  Quick
inf=
o: Canadian student willing to study anywhere (on a reasonable
budget).  Ad=
ditionally, I should be receiving a first class degree
(knock on wood).

(3=
) I am unsure as to whether or not it is necessary to get an MSc
before get=
ting a PhD.  I am 27 now (took several years off to work
before going to Un=
iversity) and would rather not spend a year doing an
MSc if it is not neces=
sary.  Then again, I know very little about this
issue.  What are people's =
opinions about this?

(4) I am not rich.  Any universities that offer the p=
otential for paid
discussion/assistant positions while studying are going t=
o have to be
tops on my list.  Is this something that I might expect from
U=
niversities or not?

Again, I am very na=EFve when it comes to post graduat=
e studies so any
information that anyone may offer would be greatly appreci=
ated.

Thanks so much for all your help so far and I look forward to readin=
g
your responses to this post.

Sincerely,
Michael Frayn
